page.description: The $ operator determines whether the character expression on the left of the operator is contained anywhere within the character expression on the right. Operations involving the $ operator return a logical result (i.e., TRUE or FALSE). The string comparison is not case sensitive. If Find_String is a null string ("") then this operator will return TRUE. While this seems a meaningless comparison, this can happen if your Find_String is stored in a variable and you neglect to test whether the variable string is empty before using this operator in an expression or script. See also Character Search Functions
page.syntax: Result as L = Find_String as C $ Search_String as C

argument.name: Find_String
argument.description: The character string that you are looking for.

section.title: Example:
section.description: For example, if Company contains "The Computer Store":
section.example:
"Computer" $ Company --> TRUE "computer" $ Company --> TRUE "computer" $ lower( Company ) --> TRUE
"" $ "alpha" --> TRUE (although a somewhat meaningless test) " " $ "alpha" --> FALSE
